inlineContent.text: For example you may have a set of articles each of which may specify a series of tags to classify its contents. Each article is declared individually by calling an initializer.

Now suppose we want our site to feature listings of articles associated with a specific tag. In this case a listing becomes its own content type. Since we don’t want to manually list the articles under each tag, a generator function can do the job for us.

The generator function will iterate over the articles and add them to the corresponding listings. When the site is declared all the generated listings are passed as normal content to be processed by suitable templates.

abstract.text: Content is usually specified individually by declaring instances of one of the site’s content types. But content can also be generated by applying a function to previously declared content.
Framework is the main entry point to generating static sites with Swift. Other related technologies are also documented and featured on this index.
With SwiftySites you define your website in a Swift Package. The package needs to contain an executable target which will depend on the SwiftySites library.
Generate static sites from Markdown using Swift.
Use templates to transform content items into the outputs that make up your website.
